SENT.plain: A family with Saethre-Chotzen syndrome with or without polydactyly of the great toes is presented
Saethre-Chotzen syndrome with polydactyly of the great toes has been reported as Robinow-Sorauf syndrome
Both syndromes were observed in this family
This suggests that Saethre-Chotzen syndrome and Robinow-Sorauf syndrome fall within the same clinical spectrum, and the cause is a pleiotropic effect, which is variously expressed
